translations.translation: He neither affirmed the truth nor did he do salat,
For he neither believed nor prayed,
But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;
The human being does not want to believe the Truth, nor does he want to pray.
Neither did he believe it to be true, nor did he offer the prayer.
So, he neither believed nor prayed!
So he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray,
For he confirmed it not, and did not pray,
For he neither trusted, nor prayed.
He neither confirmed [the messages of Allah], nor did he pray,
So he gave nothing in charity, nor did he pray!-
So he (the disbeliever) neither believed (in this Quran, in the Message of Muhammad SAW) nor prayed!
Because, he neither believed nor prayed;
And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.
[75:31] For he, man, neither affirmed [the truth] nor prayed,
(For he) i.e. Abu Jahl (neither trusted) neither believed in Allah's divine Oneness, (nor prayed) nor embraced Islam and became of those who perform the prayer.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبالجملة: إذا سُئل الإنسان حينئذٍ عمَّا أُمر له ونهي عنه في النشأة الأولى، كيف يجيب، مع أنه { فَلاَ صَدَّقَ } على من أُمر بتصديقه، ولا قَبِل منه ما هو صلاحه في دينه { وَلاَ صَلَّىٰ } [القيامة: 31] ومال إلى الله في الأوقات المكتوبة المقدَّرة للتوجه والرجوع نحوه سبحانه؟!

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ فلا صدَّق } ما يجب به التصديق، من الرسول والقرآن الذي نزل عليه، أو: فلا صدّق ماله زكاه، { ولا صَلَّى } مافُرض عليه، والضمير فيها للإنسان المذكور في قوله:

[القيامة:3]، أو: إلى المحتضر المفهوم من قوله: { إذا بلغت التراقي } ، وهو أقرب
